Package com.googlecode.cqengine.index.support

Class AbstractMapBasedAttributeIndex<A,​O,​MapType extends ConcurrentMap<A,​StoredResultSet<O>>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.googlecode.cqengine.index.support.AbstractAttributeIndex<A,​O>
      • com.googlecode.cqengine.index.support.AbstractMapBasedAttributeIndex<A,​O,​MapType>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ModificationListener<O>, AttributeIndex<A,​O>, Index<O>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CompoundIndex, HashIndex, NavigableIndex
    public abstract class AbstractMapBasedAttributeIndex<A,​O,​MapType extends ConcurrentMap<A,​StoredResultSet<O>>>
extends AbstractAttributeIndex<A,​O>
    An abstract implementation of an index backed by a ConcurrentMap, where the exact map implementation is provided by a factory supplied to the constructor.

    This class implements the methods to actually build the index and update it when objects are added or removed. Subclasses will implement methods to retrieve from the index, using logic appropriate to the particular implementation.

    This class also provides some static utility methods useful to map-based implementations.

    Author:
    Niall Gallagher

    • Constructor Detail

      • AbstractMapBasedAttributeIndex

        protected AbstractMapBasedAttributeIndex​(Factory<MapType> indexMapFactory,
                                         Factory<StoredResultSet<O>> valueSetFactory,
                                         Attribute<O,​A> attribute,
                                         Set<Class<? extends Query>> supportedQueries)
        Protected constructor, called by subclasses.
        Parameters:
        indexMapFactory - A factory used to create the main map-based data structure used by the index
        valueSetFactory - A factory used to create sets to store values in the index
        attribute - The attribute on which the index will be built
        supportedQueries - The set of Query types which the subclass implementation supports

      • isQuantized

        public boolean isQuantized()
        Indicates if the index is quantized, using a Quantizer. A method which should be overridden to return true, by subclasses which use a Quantizer. This implementation returns false by default.
        Returns:
        True if the index is quantized, false if not.

      • getQuantizedValue

        protected A getQuantizedValue​(A attributeValue)
        A no-op method which may be overridden by subclasses which use a Quantizer.

        This default implementation simply returns the given attribute value unmodified.

        Parameters:
        attributeValue - A value returned by an attribute
        Returns:
        A quantized version of the attribute value
